intro: Epimedium stearnii, commonly known as the barrenwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Berberidaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen, leathery leaves that remain on the plant throughout the year. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, which are borne on short pedicels. Epimedium stearnii typically grows in shaded, moist woodland habitats and is valued for its ornamental foliage. It is also noted for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its resistance to pests and diseases.
